field.name: name
field.doc: Given name, alias, colloquial, or short name for the lens. For manufacturer names and identifiers use respective manufacturer fields.

field.name: manufacturer_name
field.doc: Name of the manufacturer who built/constructed the lens.

field.name: model
field.doc: Hardware name, hash identifier, or serial number that was given by the manufacturer to identify the lens.

field.name: description
field.doc: Ideally an identifier, persistent link, or free text which gives further details about the lens.

field.name: speed
field.doc: Excitation voltage of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: frequency
field.doc: Excitation current of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: amplitude
field.doc: Excitation current of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: torque
field.doc: Excitation current of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: phase_angle
field.doc: Excitation current of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: viscosity
field.doc: Excitation current of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: viscosity_modulus
field.doc: Excitation current of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: elastic_modulus
field.doc: Excitation current of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: temperature
field.doc: Excitation current of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: depends_on
field.doc: Specifies the position of the lens by pointing to the last transformation in the transformation chain in the NXtransformations group.

group.doc: Collection of axis-based translations and rotations to describe the location and geometry of the lens as a component in the instrument. Typically, the components of a system should all be related relative to each other and only one component should relate to the reference coordinate system.
